speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: SCENE III. Plains in Gascony.

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Enter a Messenger that meets YORK. Enter YORK with trumpet and many Soldiers

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Are not the speedy scouts return'd again,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: That dogg'd the mighty army of the Dauphin?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: They are return'd, my lord, and give it out

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: That he is march'd to Bourdeaux with his power,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: To fight with Talbot: as he march'd along,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: By your espials were discovered

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Two mightier troops than that the Dauphin led,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Which join'd with him and made their march for Bourdeaux.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: A plague upon that villain Somerset,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: That thus delays my promised supply

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Of horsemen, that were levied for this siege!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Renowned Talbot doth expect my aid,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And I am lowted by a traitor villain

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And cannot help the noble chevalier:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: God comfort him in this necessity!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: If he miscarry, farewell wars in France.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Enter Sir William LUCY

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Thou princely leader of our English strength,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Never so needful on the earth of France,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Spur to the rescue of the noble Talbot,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Who now is girdled with a waist of iron

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: And hemm'd about with grim destruction:

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: To Bourdeaux, warlike duke! to Bourdeaux, York!

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Else, farewell Talbot, France, and England's honour.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: O God, that Somerset, who in proud heart

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Doth stop my cornets, were in Talbot's place!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: So should we save a valiant gentleman

speaker: YORK
text_entry: By forfeiting a traitor and a coward.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Mad ire and wrathful fury makes me weep,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: That thus we die, while remiss traitors sleep.

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: O, send some succor to the distress'd lord!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: He dies, we lose; I break my warlike word;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: We mourn, France smiles; we lose, they daily get;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: All 'long of this vile traitor Somerset.

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Then God take mercy on brave Talbot's soul;

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: And on his son young John, who two hours since

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: I met in travel toward his warlike father!

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: This seven years did not Talbot see his son;

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: And now they meet where both their lives are done.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Alas, what joy shall noble Talbot have

speaker: YORK
text_entry: To bid his young son welcome to his grave?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Away! vexation almost stops my breath,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: That sunder'd friends greet in the hour of death.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Lucy, farewell; no more my fortune can,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: But curse the cause I cannot aid the man.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Maine, Blois, Poictiers, and Tours, are won away,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: 'Long all of Somerset and his delay.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Exit, with his soldiers

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Thus, while the vulture of sedition

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Feeds in the bosom of such great commanders,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Sleeping neglection doth betray to loss

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: The conquest of our scarce cold conqueror,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: That ever living man of memory,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Henry the Fifth: whiles they each other cross,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Lives, honours, lands and all hurry to loss.

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Exit
